
### exec*  {.smaller}


* exec* --- _replace_ current program with new program

   * `*`: multiple variants
   * same pid, new process image

* `int execv(const char *path, const char **argv)`

   * path: new program to run
   * argv: array of arguments, terminated by null pointer

* also other variants that take argv in different form and/or environment variables

   * []{.my-small} environment variables = list of key-value pairs



### execv example  {.smaller}


```c
...
child_pid = fork();
if (child_pid == 0) {
 /* child process */
 char *args[] = {"ls", "-l", NULL};
 execv("/bin/ls", args);
 /* execv doesn't return when it works.
    So, if we got here, it failed. */
 perror("execv");
 exit(1);
} else if (child_pid > 0) {
 /* parent process */
 ...
}
```
